headline: Pepsi Just Made a $1.2 Billion Acquisition of Something That Has Nothing to Do With Carbonated Beverages
summary: After 10 years in business, the Garza family sold their company Siete Foods to PepsiCo (NASDAQ: PEP) for a cool $1.2 billion.  Pepsi is an enormous business, and for it $1.2 billion is relatively small.  The surprising thing for some investors may be that Siete Foods doesn't have a single beverage in its product portfolio, let alone any carbonated beverages.
